qns.network.topology package

Submodules

qns.network.topology.basictopo module

class qns.network.topology.basictopo.BasicTopology(nodes_number: int, **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Topology

BasicTopology includes nodes_number Qnodes. None of them are connected with each other

build() → tuple[list[QNode], list[QuantumChannel]][source]

Build the special topology

Returns:

the list of QNodes and the list of QuantumChannel

qns.network.topology.customtopo module

class qns.network.topology.customtopo.CustomTopology(topo: Topo)[source]

Bases: Topology

CustomTopology builds a topology from a JSON-like dict structure.

Nodes and channels are individually specified and can have heterogeneous parameters.

add_cchannels(**kwargs)[source]

Build classic network topology

Parameters:

  • classic_topo (ClassicTopology) – Classic topology, ClassicTopology.Empty -> no connection ClassicTopology.All -> every nodes are connected directly ClassicTopology.Follow -> follow the quantum topology

  • nl (List[qns.entity.node.node.QNode]) – a list of quantum nodes

  • ll (List[qns.entity.qchannel.qchannel.QuantumChannel]) – a list of quantum channels

build() → tuple[list[QNode], list[QuantumChannel]][source]

Build the special topology

Returns:

the list of QNodes and the list of QuantumChannel

class qns.network.topology.customtopo.TopoQChannel[source]

Bases: TypedDict

capacity: NotRequired[int]

quantity of memory qubits assigned to this qchannel at each node, defaults to 1

capacity1: NotRequired[int]

quantity of memory qubits assigned to this qchannel at node1, defaults to capacity

capacity2: NotRequired[int]

quantity of memory qubits assigned to this qchannel at node2, defaults to capacity

node1: str

first node name

node2: str

second node name

qns.network.topology.gridtopo module

class qns.network.topology.gridtopo.GridTopology(shape: int | tuple[int, int], **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Topology

GridTopology builds a grid topology with a rectangle shape. If shape is a tuple, it specifies how many rows and columns are in the topology. If shape is an integer, it specifies total number of nodes and must be a perfect square number.

build() → tuple[list[QNode], list[QuantumChannel]][source]

Build the special topology

Returns:

the list of QNodes and the list of QuantumChannel

qns.network.topology.lineartopo module

class qns.network.topology.lineartopo.LinearTopology(nodes_number: int, **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: GridTopology

LinearTopology creates a linear topology with nodes_number nodes.

qns.network.topology.randomtopo module

class qns.network.topology.randomtopo.RandomTopology(nodes_number: int, lines_number: int, **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Topology

RandomTopology includes nodes_number Qnodes. The topology is randomly generated.

Bases: Enum

Follow = 3
class qns.network.topology.topo.Topology(nodes_number: int, **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: object

Topology is a factory for QuantumNetwork

add_cchannels(*, classic_topo: ClassicTopology = ClassicTopology.Empty, nl: list[QNode] = [], ll: list[QuantumChannel] = []) → list[ClassicChannel][source]

Build classic network topology

Parameters:

  • classic_topo (ClassicTopology) – Classic topology, ClassicTopology.Empty -> no connection ClassicTopology.All -> every nodes are connected directly ClassicTopology.Follow -> follow the quantum topology

  • nl (List[qns.entity.node.node.QNode]) – a list of quantum nodes

  • ll (List[qns.entity.qchannel.qchannel.QuantumChannel]) – a list of quantum channels

build() → tuple[list[QNode], list[QuantumChannel]][source]

Build the special topology

Returns:

the list of QNodes and the list of QuantumChannel

connect_controller(nl: list[NodeT], **kwargs: Unpack[ClassicChannelInitKwargs]) → list[ClassicChannel][source]

Create a cchannel from the controller to each node.

Parameters:

nl – list of non-controller nodes.

Returns:

List of classical channels.

Raises:

RuntimeError - controller does not exist. –

Notes

If the controller is part of a network, newly created cchannels are automatically added to the network.

qns.network.topology.treetopo module

class qns.network.topology.treetopo.TreeTopology(nodes_number, children_number: int = 2, **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Topology

TreeTopology includes nodes_number Qnodes. The topology is a tree pattern, where each parent has children_num children.

build() → tuple[list[QNode], list[QuantumChannel]][source]

Build the special topology

Returns:

the list of QNodes and the list of QuantumChannel

qns.network.topology.waxmantopo module

Bases: Topology

WaxmanTopology is the random topology generator using Waxman’s model.

class qns.network.topology.GridTopology(shape: int | tuple[int, int], **kwargs: Unpack[TopologyInitKwargs])[source]

Bases: Topology

GridTopology builds a grid topology with a rectangle shape. If shape is a tuple, it specifies how many rows and columns are in the topology. If shape is an integer, it specifies total number of nodes and must be a perfect square number.
